articles.author: Deisy Buitrago, Mayela Armas
articles.description: Protests by ruling party and opposition supporters are expected to take place in Venezuela on Tuesday in the wake of a disputed election victory by President Nicolas Maduro, with the opposition saying vote tallies show its candidate easily won.
articles.title: Venezuela ruling party, opposition rally supporters in election dispute

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Thousands of Palestinians returned to their homes in the ruins of Gaza's main southern city Khan Younis on Tuesday, after Israeli forces ended a week-long incursion there which they said aimed to prevent Islamist armed group Hamas from regrouping.
articles.title: Israeli forces quit east Khan Younis, Palestinians recover dozens of bodies

articles.author: Chris Thomas, Munsif Vengattil, Jose Devasia
articles.description: At least 23 people were killed and scores injured after landslides in the hills of India's southern Kerala state, authorities said, with rescue operations were hampered after a main bridge collapsed in the region.
articles.title: Kerala's Wayanad landslide: At least 23 dead, more rain predicted

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam, Timour Azhari
articles.description: The United States is leading a diplomatic dash to deter Israel from striking Lebanon's capital Beirut or major civil infrastructure in response to a deadly rocket attack on the Golan Heights, five people with knowledge of the drive said.
articles.title: Don't bomb Beirut: U.S. leads push to rein in Israel's response

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russia's navy began planned exercises involving most of its fleet in the Arctic and Pacific oceans as well and the Baltic and Caspian seas, the defence ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russian navy starts major drills involving most of its fleet

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Mica Rosenberg, Kristina Cooke
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris, tasked to deal with the root causes of migration from Central America as illegal border crossings were rising in 2021, immediately ran into the enormity of the mission.
articles.title: Republicans call Harris a failed border czar. The truth is more complicated.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish forces targeted Kurdish militants in northern Iraq with air strikes, killing 13 members of the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK), the defence ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Turkey says it killed 13 Kurdish militants in northern Iraq

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The association representing Palestinian prisoners called for an international inquiry into allegations of abuse of detainees in Israeli jails since the start of the war in Gaza, following an outcry by right wing protesters over an Israeli investigation.
articles.title: Palestinian prisoner group demands international inquiry into abuse allegations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey and Armenia on Tuesday resumed talks aimed at normalising ties after a two-year lull and agreed to simplify visa rules for some passport holders, the two countries said.
articles.title: Turkey, Armenia make progress in normalisation talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Local authorities in the northern Italian Alps killed a mother bear deemed to be "dangerous" on Tuesday after she injured a French tourist earlier in July, spurring protests by animal rights groups.
articles.title: Killing of 'dangerous' bear in northern Italy prompts protests
